Package model

Interface IUserInterface

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    User
    public interface IUserInterface
    Interface to describe methods for a User of the stock market application. User is the main model of our application. It contains a list of fixed portfolios and flexible portfolios. Each portfolio will contain a list of stocks. This user model is the only model that is interacting with the controller. User model interacts with other models like portfolio model and stock model.

      • displayStocksOfPortFolio

        java.util.List<IstockModel> displayStocksOfPortFolio​(int portfolioIndex,
                                                     PortfolioType typeofPortfolio,
                                                     java.time.LocalDate dateForComposition)
        Displays the stocks that are present in a portfolio.
        Parameters:
        portfolioIndex - The index of the portfolio that is to be retrieved.
        typeofPortfolio - The type of the portfolio, whether it is fixed or flexible portfolio.
        dateForComposition - The date for which the portfolio need to be retrieved.
        Returns:
        The list of stocks that are present in a portfolio on a particular date.

      • getStockPriceFromDB

        java.lang.Double getStockPriceFromDB​(java.lang.String tickerNameFromUser,
                                     java.time.LocalDate transactionDate)
        Gets stock price from the database. If the stock price for a particular date is not found in the database, then we make an api call to update the stock database of the particular stock. If the stock price doesn't exist for a particular date even after making an api call, then it would mean that the market was closed on that date.
        Parameters:
        tickerNameFromUser - the ticker name for which the stock price needs to be retrieved.
        transactionDate - the date for which the stock price needs to be retrieved.
        Returns:
        the stock price from database.

      • calculateChart

        java.util.Map<java.time.LocalDate,​java.lang.String> calculateChart​(int option,
                                                                         int portfolioIndexForVal,
                                                                         PortfolioType portfolioType)
        Calculate the values that needs to be plotted on the performance chart of a portfolio. We provide user with 3 options to visualize the performance of a portfolio. 1. Performance of the portfolio in the previous week. 2. Performance of the portfolio in the previous month. 3. Performance of the portfolio in the previous year. The number of asterisks on each line is a measure of the value of the portfolio at that timestamp. The value for a date is computed at the end of that day. The value for a month is computed at the last working day of the month.
        Parameters:
        option - the option (week, month, year)
        portfolioIndexForVal - the index of the portfolio that needs to be visualized
        portfolioType - the type of the portfolio that the user needs to visualize.
        Returns:
        the map of date and string of stars for that particular date.

      • getScale

        java.lang.Double getScale​(int portfolioIndexForVal,
                          PortfolioType portfolioType)
        Gets scale of the chart. The scale of the chart indicates how many dollars are represented by each asterisk.
        Parameters:
        portfolioIndexForVal - the portfolio index for val
        portfolioType - the portfolio type
        Returns:
        the scale

      • getPortfolioName

        java.lang.String getPortfolioName​(int portfolioIndex,
                                  PortfolioType portfolioType)
        gets the name of the portfolio of the given index and the type of the portfolio.
        Parameters:
        portfolioIndex - index of the portfolio for which the name needs to be returned.
        portfolioType - the type of the portfolio
        Returns:
        the name of the portfolio
